textBeforeTable: For full specifications see the Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15 specifications page. Specifications If you would like to edit this page please first view our Editing Guidelines. Editing This Page This page is just for discussing using Linux on the Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15. For a general discussion about this laptop you can visit the Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15 page on LapWik. This a guide to running Linux with the Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15 laptop. If you have the Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15 and are running Linux on it please consider adding your comments to this page. By contributing you will help other people running this laptop or trying to make a decision on whether to buy it or not. Introduction Robert “roppert” Gravsjö Author(s) Lenovo Thinkpad Edge 15 0% (0) Unusable 0% (0) Poor 9% (1)
textAfterTable: Wireless yes Intel Wireless WiFi Next Gen AGN (iwlagn) Bluetooth Not Tested Modem Not present USB yes Card Reader Not Tested Realtek Semiconductor Corp. USB 2.0 multicard reader ExpressCard Slot Not Tested Fingerprint Reader Not present Webcam yes Lenovo Integrated Webcam [R5U877], works with media-video/ov51x-jpeg from the sunrise overlay on Gentoo Notes Tested on a ThinkPad Edge 15 0301-B4G. Everything of the above that was tested worked out of the box with Ubuntu 10.04.1. Installing Gentoo I found some good information about the wifi and the graphic: * http://en.gentoo-wiki.com/wiki/Iwlwifi * http://en.gentoo-wiki.com/wiki/Intel_GMA Summary Discussion
